analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /

original: mdor bstan nas grangs smos pa dang / zhus pa'i lan dag gis grangs kyi ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa dang / don rnam pa lnga bshad pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: mdor bstan nas grangs smos pa dang / zhus pa'i lan dag gis grangs kyi ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa dang / don rnam pa lnga bshad pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste /

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: don lnga gang zhe na /üîΩyongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang /
analyzed: don lnga gang zhe na / yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang /

original: lan dag gis grangs kyi ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: lan dag gis grangs kyi ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The thing to be fully understood, the meaning to be fully understood, full understanding, the attainment of the fruit of full understanding, and the realization of that. This is the second, the enumeration of the number in the question and answer.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /

original: dang po gnyis ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul lo /
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul lo /

original: gsum pa ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i shes pa ste /

original: rgyu'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the causal practice.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni spyod @160a * //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni spyod @160a * //
translated: The latter two are the conduct of the wise.üîΩüîΩ

original: pas thob ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pas thob ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The latter two are the results obtained by practice.

original: rigs kyi bu de la yongs su shes bar bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la yongs su shes bar bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, the things to be thoroughly known should be understood as all objects of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am de lta bu la sogs pa thams cad do zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am de lta bu la sogs pa thams cad do zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //

original: 'di yang rnam pa lnga bstan pa nyid kyi sa rnam ba lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa lnga bstan pa nyid kyi sa rnam ba lngar dbye ste /

original: 'di ni dang po'o //

analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / zlas dngos po'i bdag nyid bstan pa'o //

analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni zlas khams rnams kyang yongs su shes par bya ba yin par bstan pa ste /

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa'i bye brag ji snyed yod pa dag gis shes bya shes par bya ba gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yongs su shes par bya pa'i don rnam par bshad pa'o //

analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bden pa gnyis bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'khor ba ni nyes dmigs zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /

original: sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa gang dag 'byung bar nges pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: Whatever is the certainty of the arising of consciousnesses immediately after a consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of those.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Whatever is the object of mental factors.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni 'di lta ste /

original: sa bon ma gtogs pa gnas gzhan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa bon ma gtogs pa gnas gzhan gang yin pa ste /

original: de la dus gsum ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la dus gsum ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /

original: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the three times?

analyzed: sa bon rnams kyi chos de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gtan du 'dul ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gtan du spangs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa yang dag par bshad pa'o //

original: 'di yang rnam par dbye ba ste /

original: 'di ni dang po'o //

original: de la 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ste /

original: 'di ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag 'dul zhing 'gog par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag 'dul zhing 'gog par byed pa nyid do //

original: gtan du spangs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gog pa nyid kyi nus pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gtan du spangs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gog pa nyid kyi nus pa bstan pa ste /

original: yang dag par 'gog pa de nyid ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'gog pa de nyid ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
translated: That very complete cessation is called the fruit of asceticism.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise VyƒÅkhyƒÅyukti,üîΩit is said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gtan du 'gog pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gtan du 'gog pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi zhes bstan pa yin no // ngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa /
translated: The permanent cessation of desire, hatred, and ignorance, and the complete abandonment of desire, hatred, and ignorance, are taught as the four fruits of the ascetic life.üîΩI have taught the realization of all the qualities of the disciples and the TathƒÅgatas, whether shared in common or not,

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan ji snyed pa de dag mngon du bya bar bstan @165a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan ji snyed pa de dag mngon du bya bar bstan @165a * //

original: pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dus byas kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'dus byas kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second teaching on the conditioned fruits.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nyan thos dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa brgyad la sogs pa thun mong du gyur pa'i yon tan rnams dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i yon tan brgya bzhi bcu po de dag mngon sum du bya bar bstan pa gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa brgyad la sogs pa thun mong du gyur pa'i yon tan rnams dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i yon tan brgya bzhi bcu po de dag mngon sum du bya bar bstan pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities common to the sravakas and tathagatas are the eight liberations, etc., and the qualities exclusive to the tathagatas are the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the four purities, the ten masteries, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three mindful establishments, and the nature of being unmistaken.

original: ci'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma bstan zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / yang dag pa'i don du na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma bstan zhe na / smras pa / yang dag pa'i don du na /
translated: Why are the qualities of pratyekabuddhas not taught?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang yang ldan te /
translated: They are also endowed with the qualities of pratyekabuddhas in an ultimate sense.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore the treatise the Ornament of the Sutras states:

original: theg pa gsum char gyi yon tan spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char gyi yon tan spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of all three vehicles are taught in general.

original: mdo las ni zlas khong du chud bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las ni zlas khong du chud bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan to //
translated: But they are not taught in the sutras in brief because they are to be understood by implication.

original: yang na nyan thos kyi sde snod kyi nang du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde rab tu rig par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos kyi sde snod kyi nang du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde rab tu rig par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or they are included in the sravaka canon.üîΩThe qualities of the buddhas are taught in the sutras in brief and in detail.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams kyis gzhan dag la rgya cher ston par mdzad pa dang / rnam par phye nas ston pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa rab tu rig par byed pa'i don rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams kyis gzhan dag la rgya cher ston par mdzad pa dang / rnam par phye nas ston pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa rab tu rig par byed pa'i don rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the liberated ones, which is the knowledge of those who have realized those phenomena, is the teaching of them to others in detail and the teaching of them through analysis.

original: 'di ltar phyis thob pa'i shes pas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas mngon sum du byas pa yon tan ji snyed yod pa shes shing mngon du byed pa rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams kyis gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa dang / rnam par phye nas ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyis thob pa'i shes pas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas mngon sum du byas pa yon tan ji snyed yod pa shes shing mngon du byed pa rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams kyis gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa dang / rnam par phye nas ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the liberated ones, which is the knowledge and realization of all the qualities that exist in the realization of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena that are attained later, is the teaching of them to others in detail and the teaching of them through analysis.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba shes pa dang / rnam par grol ba myong bas gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: yang na rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid sgrib pa dang bral ba la rnam par grol ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid sgrib pa dang bral ba la rnam par grol ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the consciousnesses of liberation are the nature of transcendent wisdom, free from obscurations, called the consciousness of liberation.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition states:

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of complete understanding is enjoyment.üîΩSon of noble family, in this way, know that all topics are included in these five topics.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar na don lnga po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste /üîΩmdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar na don lnga po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste / mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is the fifth general conclusion, which is simply a summary of the s≈´tras.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa'i don rnam pa lnga yang mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun pas de las gzhan du bshad pa med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa'i don rnam pa lnga yang mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun pas de las gzhan du bshad pa med do //
translated: Since the five topics taught in the treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition are in accord with what is taught in the s≈´tras, they are not explained here in any other way.

analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa @165b las ni tshig rnam pa gnyis 'byung bas /

analyzed: tshig snga ma dang sbyar na don rnam pa drug tu phye nas tshig gi don bshad pa yang cung zad mi mthun te /
translated: If one applies the former words, the explanation of the meaning of the words is slightly different, having divided the meaning into six topics.üîΩTherefore, it should be understood from that treatise itself.

analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni 'di lta ste /

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag cing dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pa'o //

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intrinsic nature of what is to be understood is as follows:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so //

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of understanding is as follows:

original: rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation.

original: de rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste //

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bstan pa'i tshig phyi ma dang sbyar na /

analyzed: de la ro myang ba zhes bya ba'i mdo zhes bya ba khungs su bzhag nas mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i don lnga po de dag ston pas ming ni mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun yang tshig gi don bshad pa ni tha dad pas de'i phyir de nyid las
translated: The sutra called ‚ÄúTasting‚Äù is cited as the source, and the five topics taught in this sutra are shown to be consistent with the sutra‚Äôs name, but the explanation of the meaning of the words is different. Therefore the Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The things to be thoroughly known are as follows:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form and so on.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning to be thoroughly known is as follows:

original: ro myang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ro myang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Tasting and so on.

original: don gyi bye brag des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bye brag des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that specific meaning, that thing, form and so on, is thoroughly known.

original: yongs su shes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po de dag la de ltar gsum du bsgyur bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //

original: de la gsum du bsgyur ba ni snga ma'i yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes par byed pa 'di nyid la gsum du bsgyur ba zhes bya ste /

translated: The transformation into three is the transformation of the above three things to be understood, the object to be understood, and the understanding itself, into three.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag la lan gsum du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag la lan gsum du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the five aggregates are discerned three times.

original: bshad pa gzhan du na phung po lnga po dag la lan gsum du so sor rtog pa'i phyir gsum du bsgyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan du na phung po lnga po dag la lan gsum du so sor rtog pa'i phyir gsum du bsgyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: According to another explanation, the transformation into three is so called because the five aggregates are discerned three times.

original: dang po ni ro myang ba nyid du kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni ro myang ba nyid du kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The first is the discernment of the truth of origination as enjoyment.

original: gnyis pa ni nyes dmigs su sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyes dmigs su sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //

original: gsum pa ni nges par 'byung ba nyid du lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nges par 'byung ba nyid du lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The third is the discernment of the truths of the path and cessation as the very going forth.

original: @166a * // yang na mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / bsgrub par bskul ba dang / rtog pa'i bskor ba la gsum du bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @166a * // yang na mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / bsgrub par bskul ba dang / rtog pa'i bskor ba la gsum du bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the three are the teaching of the characteristics, the exhortation to practice, and the turning of the wheel of the teaching.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of complete understanding is as follows:

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this world with its gods,

original: lha dang mi dang bcas pa'i bar las rnam par grol ba nas rnam par thar pa rab tu grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang bcas pa'i bar las rnam par grol ba nas rnam par thar pa rab tu grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to being liberated from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, up to being completely liberated, completely free.

original: de rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The complete understanding of that is as follows:

original: bdag nyid kyis bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge that one has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni don rnam pa bzhi so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni don rnam pa bzhi so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Furthermore, son of noble family, those bodhisattvas are called those who have correct understanding of the meaning because they have the four correct understandings of the meaning.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa don rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa don rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: From here on, the third correct understanding of the meaning is explained, beginning with the four aspects of the meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the brief explanation, the detailed explanation, and the conclusion. This is the first.

original: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: What are the four aspects of the meaning? and so on explain the second, the detailed explanation.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is also explained by the question and answer. This is the first.

original: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The second correct answer is given in terms of the meaning of mind as appropriator, the meaning of experience, the meaning of representation, and the meaning of defilement and purification.

original: don rnam pa bzhi po 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi po 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of these four meanings.

original: kha cig na re sems kyi len pa'i don zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems kyi len pa'i don zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that the meaning of mind as appropriator is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyis sems yul len par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis sems yul len par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that appropriates the object by means of the mind itself.

original: myong ba'i don zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: myong ba'i don zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of experience is as follows.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyis myong ba'i don shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyis myong ba'i don shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that experiences the meaning of the three kinds of sensation.

original: rnam par rig pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of representation is as follows.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul so sor rig pa'i don shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul so sor rig pa'i don shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that represents the meaning of the individual objects of the consciousnesses.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of defilement and purification is as follows.

original: chos thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the defilement and purification of all things.

original: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that these four are the four objects of observation of the four applications of mindfulness, respectively, which are:

original: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of body, feeling, mind, and dharmas.

original: de la sems kyi len pa zhes @166b gsungs pa ni len par byed pa smos shing blang bar bya ba'i lus bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi len pa zhes @166b gsungs pa ni len par byed pa smos shing blang bar bya ba'i lus bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúthe appropriation of mind‚Äù indicates the appropriator, and the statement ‚Äúthe appropriated body‚Äù indicates the appropriated.

original: rigs kyi bu don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, you should know that all objects are included in these four objects.‚Äù This is the third conclusion, which should be understood.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni don rnam pa gsum so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni don rnam pa gsum so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa don rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, those bodhisattvas are called those who have correct understanding of the meaning because they have the correct understanding of three kinds of meaning.

original: / don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: / don so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: From here on, it explains the correct understanding of the meaning, beginning with the three kinds of meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / ming bkod pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / ming bkod pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the brief introduction, the listing of the names, and the detailed explanation. This is the first.

original: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of meaning?

original: tshig 'bru'i don dang khams kyi don gyis so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang lan dag gis ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru'i don dang khams kyi don gyis so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa dang lan dag gis ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words and the meaning of the elements. This is the second, the question and answer that list the names.

original: rigs kyi bu de la tshig 'bru'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la tshig 'bru'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, the meaning of the words is as follows:

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of names and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: This and so on teaches the third, the detailed explanation.

original: 'di yang don rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di yang don rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is also divided into three parts by the teaching of the three topics, and this is the first.

original: de la tshig 'bru'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshig 'bru'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The topic of the letter is as follows:

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang yin pa ste ming la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag kun kyang gsal ba'i don dang ldan pas tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang yin pa ste ming la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag kun kyang gsal ba'i don dang ldan pas tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of syllables. These three, name, etc., are all called ‚Äúcollection‚Äù because they have the meaning of manifestation.

original: yang na tshogs zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: yang na tshogs zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi don te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is the meaning of intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa gsum po de dag kun kyang ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa gsum po de dag kun kyang ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, all of these three, name, etc., are called ‚Äúcollection‚Äù because they have intrinsic nature.

original: gsum po 'di dag gis don ston pa gang yin pa de ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag gis don ston pa gang yin pa de ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is taught by these three is called ‚Äúletter.‚Äù

original: tshig 'bru 'di nyid ni brjod par bya ba'i don yin pas de'i phyir tshig 'bru'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru 'di nyid ni brjod par bya ba'i don yin pas de'i phyir tshig 'bru'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: This very letter is the meaning to be expressed, and therefore it is called ‚Äúthe topic of the letter.‚Äù

original: don gyi don ni rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa don gyi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi don ni rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa don gyi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the second, the explanation of the meaning of the meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: mdor bstan pa dang grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: the brief presentation and the enumeration of the names in order.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshig 'bru'i don gyi don nyid do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshig 'bru'i don gyi don nyid do //
translated: It is the meaning of the meaning of the words taught above.

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of reality and so on is the second, the enumeration of the names in order.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po ste /
translated: This is the first characteristic.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the characteristic of reality of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las /
translated: Therefore, it is said in a sutra below:

original: bden pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the truth,

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: which is the thusness of phenomena.

original: bden pa nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid @167a * //üîΩyin pas so //
analyzed: bden pa nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid @167a * //üîΩyin pas so //
translated: The characteristic of truth is the characteristic of reality.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang // gtan du spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang // mngon du byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang // gtan du spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang // mngon du byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: the characteristics of complete realization,üîΩand the characteristics of complete cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi po dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi po dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: These four characteristics are, respectively, the characteristics of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni mtshan nyid ni drug pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di man chad ni mtshan nyid ni drug pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the aspects of those such as reality and so on are the characteristics of the divisions of those characteristics.

original: 'di ni sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag re re re la yang don gyi rnam grangs kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po yod pas so ;
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag re re re la yang don gyi rnam grangs kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po yod pas so ;
translated: This is because each of the five characteristics previously explained has many different aspects that are synonyms of the meaning.

original: / gnas dang gnas rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid bden pa ste /
analyzed: / gnas dang gnas rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid bden pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the basis and the basis of the basis are the characteristics of the truths.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: The treatise Exposition of the Faculties states:

original: gnas dang gnas par rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas par rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of being related as basis and based is as follows:

original: 'byung ba chen po ni gnas yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni gnas yin la /
translated: The primary elements are the basis,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: and derivative form is the based.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa ni gnas yin la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin no //üîΩyang na brjod par bya ba ni gnas yin la /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa ni gnas yin la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin no // yang na brjod par bya ba ni gnas yin la /
translated: Alternatively, the eyes and so on are the basis and the eye consciousness and so on are the based.

original: rjod par byed pa ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the object of expression is the basis and the means of expression is the based.

original: phan tshun 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Any mutual relationship is called the characteristic of being related.

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid brgyad pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of being an object that obstructs is the eighth characteristic.

original: bden pa bzhi po dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po dag gis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Any affliction that is to be abandoned by the four truths is called the characteristic of being an object that obstructs.

original: mdo'i tshig 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa'i bar du gcod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa'i bar du gcod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If it is applied to the words of the sutra that will be taught below, it is as follows: Whatever afflicted phenomena are obstacles to cultivating the factors of enlightenment are called the characteristics of phenomena that are obstacles to that.

original: de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid dgu pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid dgu pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of phenomena that are in accordance with them is the ninth characteristic.

original: bden pa bzhi po dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that abandons afflictions through the four noble truths is called the characteristic of phenomena that are in accordance with them.

original: mdo'i tshig 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na ni /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na ni /
translated: If it is applied to the words of the sutra that will be taught below,

original: de dag la bya ba mang du byed pa'i chos yod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la bya ba mang du byed pa'i chos yod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the phenomena that have many activities in relation to those are called the characteristic of phenomena that are in accordance with them.

original: yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bcu @167b pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bcu @167b pa ste /
translated: The ten characteristics are:üîΩignorance, etc.,üîΩthe disadvantages, and the good qualities.

original: 'di ltar yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la yon tan nyid du rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la yon tan nyid du rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: Thus, the disadvantages are differentiated in relation to ignorance, etc., and the good qualities are differentiated in relation to the knowledge of complete understanding, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the S≈´tra states below:

original: de dag gi nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni bar du gcod pa'i chos de dag gi nyes dmigs ji snyed yod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni bar du gcod pa'i chos de dag gi nyes dmigs ji snyed yod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe characteristic of their disadvantages should be understood as the disadvantages of those unfavorable factors.

original: de dag gi phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos de dag yon tan ji snyed yod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos de dag yon tan ji snyed yod pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of their benefits should be understood as the benefits of those favorable factors.‚Äù

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na bden pa bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na bden pa bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the teaching of the four noble truths is said to be the characteristic of reality.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las dang po ni bden pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las dang po ni bden pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says, ‚ÄúThe first is the definition of the truths.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid gzhan dgu po dag gi ming ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan dgu po dag gi ming ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The names of the other nine definitions are the same as those found in this sutra.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //üîΩkun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni gtan du spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o // kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni gtan du spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is defined as that which is to be thoroughly known.üîΩThe truth of the origin of suffering is defined as that which is to be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is defined as that which is to be manifested.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The truth of the path is defined as that which is to be meditated upon.

original: bden pa rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths are defined as the aspects of those very suchnesses, such as impermanence, and so on.

original: rgyu kun 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu lam dang / 'bras bu 'gog pa phan tshun mthun par gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu kun 'byung ba dang / 'bras bu sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu lam dang / 'bras bu 'gog pa phan tshun mthun par gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the mutual compatibility of the cause, i.e. the origin of suffering, and the result, i.e. suffering, and of the cause, i.e. the path, and the result, i.e. cessation, is called the characteristic of the relation between the receptacle and what is contained in it.

original: de la rgyu ni gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: In this respect, the cause is called the receptacle.

original: 'bras bu ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbden pa bzhi'i gnas kyi chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gnas pa zhes bya'o // bden pa bzhi'i gnas kyi chos bstan pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The result is called what is contained in it.üîΩThe teaching of the dharmas which are the receptacle of the four truths is called the characteristic of the dharmas which obstruct the full understanding, etc.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyogs la sogs pa ni de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyogs la sogs pa ni de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The side of thorough analysis, etc. is called the characteristic of the dharmas which are in conformity with them.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / yongs su shes pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / yongs su shes pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The faults of the afflictions and the virtues of thorough knowledge are called the characteristics of thorough knowledge, etc.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise entitled Compendium of Various Dharmas

original: ro myang ba'i mdo khungs su bzhag nas mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu po dag zhib tu ston te /
analyzed: ro myang ba'i mdo khungs su bzhag nas mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu po dag zhib tu ston te /
translated: presents the ten characteristics in detail, citing the S≈´tra on Experiencing the Tastes as a source.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /üîΩnye @168a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste / nye @168a * //
translated: Therefore, that treatise itself says, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of reality is as follows:

original: bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the truth of suffering included in the five appropriated aggregates.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of thorough knowledge is as follows:

original: ro myang ba la sogs pas de dag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba la sogs pas de dag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //

analyzed: smras pa / theg pa chen po'i gzhung gi bstan pa dang sbyar na yang dag pa'i don du na thos ba la sogs pa'i shes rab gsum char don dang tshig 'bru shes pa yin te /

analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang mthong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is seeing?

original: shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las ci mthong ba rnams shes pa yin zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: It is the discernment associated with the five aggregates of consciousness, the knowledge of elimination and non-arising, the five views, and the contaminated discernment associated with mental consciousness, except for mundane right view.

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: It is the five views, mundane right view, uncontaminated patience, uncontaminated discernment other than the knowledge of elimination and non-arising, the eight knowledges of the learner, and the right view of the non-learner.

original: lan du gsungs so //
analyzed: lan du gsungs so //

original: nam ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa na de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni zhus pa gsum ba'i lan du gsungs pa ste /

translated: When a name is not apprehended as the intrinsic reality of a name, one does not see the sign of its basis, and thus it is eliminated.

original: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i cho ga bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i cho ga bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the answer to the third question, and it teaches the method of cultivating yoga.

analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /

analyzed: ming las brtsams nas rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa dang / zlas tshig la sogs pa bstan pa'o //

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ming la so sor rtog pa'i tshe //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ming la so sor rtog pa'i tshe //

analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i tshe ming 'ba' zhing dmigs su med par mthong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: When they investigate in this way, they do not see that names alone are not observed.

original: ming la sogs pa de dag ni gnas mngon par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par shes pa la yang mi rtog go //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa de dag ni gnas mngon par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par shes pa la yang mi rtog go //
translated: They also do not conceive of names, etc. as the nature of the superknowledge of the bases in consciousness.

original: bshad pa gzhan du na mngon par zhen pa'i ming dmigs su med pas mthong ba'i tshe kun du brtags pa'i ming la sogs pa de dag gi gnas gzhan gyi dbang dang ming la sogs pa la yang mi rtog ste de ni 'di skad du de bzhin nyid bsgom
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan du na mngon par zhen pa'i ming dmigs su med pas mthong ba'i tshe kun du brtags pa'i ming la sogs pa de dag gi gnas gzhan gyi dbang dang ming la sogs pa la yang mi rtog ste de ni 'di skad du de bzhin nyid bsgom
translated: If it is explained in another way, when one sees the name of manifest clinging to be unobservable, one does not conceive of the other dependent phenomena that are the bases of those imaginary names and so on.

original: pa la zhugs nas mngon par zhen pa bsal ba na gzhan gyi dbang dang ming la sogs pa snang bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i stong pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid ci yang med par brtags pa la rnam par sel bar zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa la zhugs nas mngon par zhen pa bsal ba na gzhan gyi dbang dang ming la sogs pa snang bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i stong pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid ci yang med par brtags pa la rnam par sel bar zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught in the following way: When one engages in meditation on suchness and eliminates manifest clinging, the dependent phenomena and names and so on do not appear. Therefore it is taught that one does not eliminate the emptiness that is called elimination and the imaginary nature that is conceived to be utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore Master BhƒÅviveka says in his Subcommentary on the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon sum du gyur pa na yul gyi don thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon sum du gyur pa na yul gyi don thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching that when nonconceptual wisdom is manifest, all objects and their referents do not appear.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis kun brtags pa yongs su bsal ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las de bzhin nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis kun brtags pa yongs su bsal ba'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, in the Exposition of the Compendium of Abhidharma, when the yoga of suchness eliminates the imputed,

original: gzhan gyi dbang snang thar mi 'gyur bas dmigs su med @177b pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang snang thar mi 'gyur bas dmigs su med @177b pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it explains that because the dependent does not appear, it is said to be unobservable.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las snang bar mi 'gyur bas dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yongs su btsal ba na rang gi ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba la bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las snang bar mi 'gyur bas dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yongs su btsal ba na rang gi ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba la bya'i /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise, unobservable because it does not appear refers to the nonseeing of the intrinsic reality of phenomena when they are investigated.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa la bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa la bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not refer to the complete absence of anything at all.

original: 'on kyang kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang gi rang gi mtshan nyid la so sor rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang gi rang gi mtshan nyid la so sor rtog par mi byed de /
translated: However, when the imputed nature is not observed, the dependent nature is not discerned.

original: so sor mi rtog pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang mi snang ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: so sor mi rtog pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang mi snang ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it does not discriminate, the other-dependent does not appear.üîΩAs it is with names, so it is with all phrases and letters and meanings.

original: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge dang / don thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa zlas tshig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge dang / don thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa zlas tshig la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the second type of double entendre.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also of two kinds:

original: zlas tshig dang / yi ge dang / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang / zlas don rnam pa lnga la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zlas tshig dang / yi ge dang / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang / zlas don rnam pa lnga la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the ten kinds of meanings of phrases, letters, and meanings, and the teaching of the five kinds of meanings of phrases, and so on.

original: khams kyi bar zhes bya ba man chad kyis ni zlas don rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khams kyi bar zhes bya ba man chad kyis ni zlas don rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to the end of the passage, ‚Äúthe realm,‚Äù the third kind of double entendre is taught.

original: 'di ni dang po zlas don rnam pa gsum po tshig dang yi ge dang / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zlas don rnam pa gsum po tshig dang yi ge dang / don rnam pa bcu bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first of the three kinds of double entendre, the teaching of the ten kinds of meanings of phrases, letters, and meanings.

original: ji ltar ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: When the intrinsic reality of names is not perceived in names,

original: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par mi mthong ba de bzhin du tshig dang yi ge dang don rnam pa bcu po re re la yang rang gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa dang / de dag gi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par mi mthong ba de bzhin du tshig dang yi ge dang don rnam pa bcu po re re la yang rang gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa dang / de dag gi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as one does not see the sign of the location of the name, in the same way, one should understand that one does not apprehend the intrinsic reality of each of the ten aspects of the word, the letter, and the referent, and one does not see the sign of their location, as before.

original: khams kyi bar la yang khams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa na de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas de ltar rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas don rnam pa lnga la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khams kyi bar la yang khams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa na de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas de ltar rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zlas don rnam pa lnga la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to the elements, when one does not apprehend the intrinsic reality of the elements, one does not see the sign of their location. Thus, it is eliminated. This is the explanation of the second dyad, the five aspects of the meaning, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: don rnam pa lnga dang / don rnam pa bzhi dang / don rnam pa gsum bstan pa las tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don zhes bya ba nas khams lnga bo'i bar dag gam /
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga dang / don rnam pa bzhi dang / don rnam pa gsum bstan pa las tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don zhes bya ba nas khams lnga bo'i bar dag gam /
translated: From the explanation of the five aspects of the meaning, the four aspects of the meaning, and the three aspects of the meaning, from the meaning of the words and the meaning of the referent up to the five elements,

original: yang na tshig 'bru'i don dang don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyi bar dag gang yin pa de dag re re la yang don rnam pa gnyis gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yang na tshig 'bru'i don dang don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyi bar dag gang yin pa de dag re re la yang don rnam pa gnyis gnyis yod de /
translated: Or else, each of the meanings of the words, the meaning of the meaning, and so on up to the meaning of the realm, has two kinds of meaning.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / de dag gi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / de dag gi gnas kyi mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-apprehension of their own nature and the non-perception of the sign of their basis should be understood as above.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sgo de dag kyang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sgo de dag kyang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: These doors of yoga are as they are taught in the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las @178a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las @178a * //
