translated: A beginning and an end are not apprehended, and the limit of going and coming is not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of non-discarded is as follows:

original: dor zhing bsal ba dag dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dor zhing bsal ba dag dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Discarding and removing are apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdor zhing @183a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdor zhing @183a * //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature is as follows:üîΩThe essential nature of all phenomena is not discarded.

original: bsal ba med pas yongs su spang bar bya ba med pa dag dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsal ba med pas yongs su spang bar bya ba med pa dag dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the non-abandonment of the non-removal of the non-existence of the existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of own-being is as follows:

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'dus byas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid dam 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de dag ni theg pa gsum po dag gis byas pa ma yin gzhan gyis kyang byas pa ma yin pa gang yin
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis 'dus byas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid dam 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de dag ni theg pa gsum po dag gis byas pa ma yin gzhan gyis kyang byas pa ma yin pa gang yin
translated: All dharmas, whether they are the own-being of compounded dharmas or the own-being of uncompounded dharmas, are not made by the three vehicles, nor are they made by anything else.

original: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The own-characteristics are as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The own-characteristic of all dharmas is the transformation of the own-being of form, which is obstructed and resistant.

original: myong ba ni tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: myong ba ni tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The own-characteristic of feeling is experience.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The own-characteristic of perception is the apprehension of marks.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'dus byed kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'dus byed kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of formation is the individual characteristic of the formative forces.

original: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /üîΩ'dus byas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste / 'dus byas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is the individual characteristic of consciousness.üîΩThe individual characteristic of the conditioned or the individual characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the conditioned or the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The universal characteristic is as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The universal characteristic of all dharmas.

original: dper na sdug bsngal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: For example, suffering is the universal characteristic of all dharmas with outflows.

original: mi rtag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Impermanence is the universal characteristic of all dharmas with outflows.üîΩNon-self is the universal characteristic of all dharmas.

original: bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de lta bu la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de lta bu la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Such are the innumerable universal characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: chos thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: All phenomena are as follows:

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad de gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad de gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang /
translated: the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements, which are either physical or not physical, either demonstrable or not demonstrable, either impeded or unimpeded,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas gang yin pa'o //
translated: either contaminated or uncontaminated, either conditioned or unconditioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: mi dmigs pa ni 'di ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni 'di ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pa /
translated: Non-apprehension is as follows: all phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dus gsum mi dmigs pas 'das pa la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa dang / da ltar la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mi dmigs pas 'das pa la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa dang / da ltar la dus gnyis med pas mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The past is non-apprehensible because it lacks two times, the future is non-apprehensible because it lacks two times, and the present is non-apprehensible because it lacks two times.

original: bcom ldan 'das @183b kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @183b kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'di la dngos po cung zad tsam yang mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'di la dngos po cung zad tsam yang mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-things is the non-apprehension of any thing whatsoever.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is as follows:

original: chos rnams kyi 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the essential nature of the combination of things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of non-things is as follows:

original: chos rnams la 'dus par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'dus par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa med pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams la 'dus par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'dus par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa med pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The non-existence of the essential nature of the combination of things and the essential nature of the combined.

original: de la dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnon-thing‚Äù is the absence of the nature of things.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gnyi ga bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gnyi ga bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEssential nature‚Äù is taught as including both.

original: gzhan yang stong pa nyid ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang stong pa nyid ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, emptiness is of four kinds:

original: dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The existence of things, the non-existence of things, their own-nature, and the nature of others.

original: de la dngos po yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The existence of things is as follows:

original: 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The unconditioned.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Their own-nature is as follows:

original: chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of all things by their own-nature.

original: stong pa nyid de yang shes pas byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de yang shes pas byas pa ma yin /
translated: That emptiness is not made by knowledge,

original: mthong bas byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: mthong bas byas pa ma yin /
translated: not made by seeing,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: not made by others.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Others means as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagata arises in the world or not,

original: chos thams cad ni chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba nas yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i bar dag yin pas thams cad kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba nas yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i bar dag yin pas thams cad kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: all things are said to be the fixedness of the dharmas, up to the limit of reality. Therefore, all things are empty because of the nature of others.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dum bu gnyis pa las ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dum bu gnyis pa las ni /
translated: Moreover, in the second chapter of the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra,

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad ston par mdzad de /
translated: it teaches the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: sngar bstan pa'i stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu dang / spros pa dang bsdus pa'i bye brag yod kyang don la ni yangs dog med do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu dang / spros pa dang bsdus pa'i bye brag yod kyang don la ni yangs dog med do //
translated: Although there are distinctions of elaboration and summary, in reality there is no difference in size.

original: rnam pa nyi shu las dor ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni dor ba dang dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu las dor ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni dor ba dang dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pas so //
translated: From the twenty kinds, the unchanging and the discarded are combined into one as the emptiness of discard and non-discard, and the emptiness of specific and general characteristics are combined into one as the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dum bu gsum pa las ni stong pa nyid bcu dgu'i ming bkod nas rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dum bu gsum pa las ni stong pa nyid bcu dgu'i ming bkod nas rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
translated: In the third chapter of the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, after listing the names of the nineteen kinds of emptiness, there is no explanation.

original: de yang stong pa nyid dang po rnam pa bcu drug ni sngar bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid dang po rnam pa bcu drug ni sngar bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: Moreover, the first sixteen kinds of emptiness are consistent with what was taught earlier.

original: stong pa nyid phyi ma gsum la ni bye brag yod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid phyi ma gsum la ni bye brag yod de /
translated: The latter three kinds of emptiness have specific differences.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag po stong pa nyid dang / gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid do zhes @184a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag po stong pa nyid dang / gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid do zhes @184a * //
translated: the emptiness of the objective support, the emptiness of the dominant condition, and the emptiness of one another.

original: 'byung ngo // dum bu gsum pa las stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa yang stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu las rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba de mtshan nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: 'byung ngo // dum bu gsum pa las stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug bstan pa yang stong pa nyid rnam pa nyi shu las rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba de mtshan nyid ces gcig tu bsdus pa dang /
translated: The third chapter also teaches sixteen kinds of emptiness, which are included in the twenty kinds of emptiness, because the emptiness of intrinsic identity and the emptiness of universal characteristics are combined as one called ‚Äúthe emptiness of characteristics.‚Äù

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la tshang bas so //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la tshang bas so //
translated: The emptiness of nonrejection, the emptiness of nonapprehension, and the emptiness of nature are included in the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de la ming la bye brag yod pa yang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba de dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ming la bye brag yod pa yang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba de dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The difference in name is that the emptiness of the invariable is called the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ni stong pa nyid nyi shu bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ni stong pa nyid nyi shu bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: The explanation of the characteristics is in accordance with the explanation in the Twenty Verses on the emptinesses.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dum bu gnyis pa bam po bzhi brgya gsum pa las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dum bu gnyis pa bam po bzhi brgya gsum pa las ni /
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Two Chapters, in the fourth and third hundred,

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa bdun yod par bstan te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa bdun yod par bstan te /
translated: seven kinds of emptiness are taught.

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
translated: The five aggregates, the twelve sense-spheres, the eighteen elements, the four truths, the twelve members of dependent origination, and all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are merely designated as having an inherent nature, but there is no explanation.

original: le'u chen po mdo las ni /
analyzed: le'u chen po mdo las ni /
translated: In the Great Chapter S≈´tra,

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / stong pa nyid bzhi zhes ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / stong pa nyid bzhi zhes ston to //
translated: eighteen kinds of emptiness and four kinds of emptiness are taught.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: In the Commentary on the Noble Perfection of Wisdom,

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / stong pa nyid bzhi zhes ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / stong pa nyid bzhi zhes ston to //
translated: The eighteen kinds of emptiness and the four kinds of emptiness are taught.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin nyid las stong pa nyid bco brgyad po nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mjug tu thams cad las rtag pa yang ma yin 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i don de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin nyid las stong pa nyid bco brgyad po nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mjug tu thams cad las rtag pa yang ma yin 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i don de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, in the passage that states, ‚Äúbecause of the non-cessation and non-arising of emptiness,‚Äù what is the meaning of the eighteen kinds of emptiness, such as the emptiness of internal phenomena, etc.?

original: smras pa / gang gis stong pa nyid 'di ma bsgoms na gdon mi za bar mtha' gnyis po rtag pa'am chad pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gis stong pa nyid 'di ma bsgoms na gdon mi za bar mtha' gnyis po rtag pa'am chad pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: We respond: If one does not cultivate this emptiness, one will certainly fall into the two extremes of eternalism or nihilism.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gal te chos rnams yang dag par yod pa zhig yin na ni 'gag pa'i don med par 'gyur bas rtag pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams yang dag par yod pa zhig yin na ni 'gag pa'i don med par 'gyur bas rtag pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If phenomena were real, then they would not have the meaning of cessation, and so one would fall into the extreme of eternalism.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig khang pa gcig nas byung ste /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig khang pa gcig nas byung ste /
translated: For example, suppose someone comes out of one houseüîΩand enters another house.

original: khang pa gcig tu 'jug pa mig gis mi mthong ba yang med ces byar mi rung ba bzhin du chos rnams kyang de bzhin te /üîΩma 'ongs ba'i dus nas ni da ltar gyi dus su 'jug la /
analyzed: khang pa gcig tu 'jug pa mig gis mi mthong ba yang med ces byar mi rung ba bzhin du chos rnams kyang de bzhin te / ma 'ongs ba'i dus nas ni da ltar gyi dus su 'jug la /
translated: Likewise, phenomena are like that.üîΩIf they were to enter the present from the future and enter the past from the present, they would not cease in the present.

original: da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'jug na ni da ltar 'gag pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na rnal 'byor ba dag ni yod pa la nyes dmigs su lta bas stong pa nyid kyis yod par 'dzin par @184b byed do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus nas 'das pa'i dus su 'jug na ni da ltar 'gag pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na rnal 'byor ba dag ni yod pa la nyes dmigs su lta bas stong pa nyid kyis yod par 'dzin par @184b byed do //
translated: However, since yogis see the faults of existence, they apprehend emptiness as existence.üîΩIf they see emptiness as sublime and cling to emptiness, they would fall into the view of annihilation.

original: sems kyang stong pa nyid la gya nom pa nyid du bltas nas stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par byed na ni chad pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa dag stong pa nyid kyis yod pa 'jig par byed kyang stong pa nyid
analyzed: sems kyang stong pa nyid la gya nom pa nyid du bltas nas stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par byed na ni chad pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa dag stong pa nyid kyis yod pa 'jig par byed kyang stong pa nyid
translated: Therefore, although yogis destroy existence with emptiness, they do not cling to emptiness.

original: mngon par zhen par yang mi byed pas mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam du 'jug ste /

analyzed: mdo 'di yang de dang mthun par phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar bstan to //

analyzed: dper na chu'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyis bsil ba yin yang /

analyzed: ma skyes pa'i tshe ni stong zhing dmigs su med de /

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis chos kyi mtshan nyid kyang med pa'i bar du rnam par gzhig pa bzhin no zhes bshad do /

original: 'dir ni mdo 'di bshad pa yang so so nas mi mthun te //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdo 'di bshad pa yang so so nas mi mthun te //
translated: Here, the explanation of this s≈´tra is also not uniform.

analyzed: kha cig na re nang stong pa nyid kyis ni nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
translated: Some say: By inner emptiness, the inner sign of pleasure is eliminated.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
translated: By inner and outer emptiness, the sign of beauty is eliminated.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma gnyi ga spyir rnam par sel to zhe'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma gnyi ga spyir rnam par sel to zhe'o //
translated: By emptiness of essential nature, the sign of both is eliminated in general.

original: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma gnyis rnam par sel to zhe'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma gnyis rnam par sel to zhe'o //

original: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni nang gi bed pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni nang gi bed pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
translated: Some say: By inner and outer emptiness, the sign of inner objects is eliminated.

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir @188a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir @188a * //
translated: Because they are included in the number of sentient beings,

original: nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang zhes bya'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir phyi zhes bya'o //

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to zhe'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to zhe'o //
translated: By emptiness of intrinsic nature, the sign of the pleasant is eliminated.

original: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma rnam par sel te 'di ltar skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do
analyzed: kha cig na re phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma rnam par sel te 'di ltar skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do
translated: Some say: By inner and outer emptiness, the sign of inner pleasure is eliminated because the twelve internal and external bases are possessed by men, women and so on.

original: // rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: // rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis ni sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed do zhe'o //
translated: By emptiness of intrinsic nature, the sign of the pleasant is eliminated.

original: phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma ci'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do zhes ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma ci'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed do zhes ma bstan zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i don du phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel bar byed mod kyi /

analyzed: sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ma bstan to //

original: gzhan gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma drug pa ston to //
analyzed: gzhan gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma drug pa ston to //
translated: The six signs are taught by the phrase the existence of the signs of the immeasurables and so on, for the sake of understanding the meaning of the other abodes.

original: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the teaching of signs and the teaching of emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of signs.

original: 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten rnam par gzhag pa'i don gyi phyir stong gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa yod par gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten rnam par gzhag pa'i don gyi phyir stong gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa yod par gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, for the sake of understanding the meaning of the arrangement of the world vessel taught earlier, the existence of the signs of the trichiliocosm and so on.

original: de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur ba'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur ba'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //

original: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Great Nirvana Sutra,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is called the emptiness of the great.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra,

analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe emptiness of the great is as follows:

analyzed: phyogs bcu stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the emptiness of the ten directions.‚ÄùüîΩIn the noble Perfection of Wisdom Commentary,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'gyur ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'gyur ste /
translated: it is mostly in accordance with what is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra.

original: de la bye brag yod pa ni don rnam pa drug gi chen po stong pa nyid kyi ming yongs su rdzogs par ston te /
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa ni don rnam pa drug gi chen po stong pa nyid kyi ming yongs su rdzogs par ston te /
translated: There, the difference is that the name of the emptiness of the great with six aspects of meaning is fully taught.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las ci'i phyir phyogs bcu stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las ci'i phyir phyogs bcu stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the same commentary states, ‚ÄúWhy is the emptiness of the ten directions called the emptiness of the great?

original: smras pa / shar phyogs la mtha' med pa'i phyir dang gnas thams cad du yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu yod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la phan @188b 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnam par rmongs par mi byed pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / shar phyogs la mtha' med pa'i phyir dang gnas thams cad du yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu yod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la phan @188b 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / sems can rnam par rmongs par mi byed pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called great because the east is limitless, because it exists in all abodes, because it pervades all forms, because it always exists, because it benefits the world, and because it does not confuse sentient beings.

original: chen po de lta bus gdod 'jig par nus pa'i phyir chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chen po de lta bus gdod 'jig par nus pa'i phyir chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is destroyed by such a great thing, it is called the emptiness of the great.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //

original: mdo 'di las ni phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par bstan to //
translated: This sutra teaches for the most part in accordance with the teachings of the noble Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: gzugs med pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'i phyir nang gi zhib rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma bdun pa ston to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'i phyir nang gi zhib rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma bdun pa ston to //
translated: The phrase the sign of inner peace and so forth indicates the seventh sign.

original: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the teaching of the sign and the teaching of emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o /
translated: This is the teaching of the sign.

original: 'di ltar gong du 'dod pa dang gzugs khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma bstan pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du 'dod pa dang gzugs khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma bstan pas /
translated: Since the signs of the desire and form realms were taught above,

original: gzugs med pa'i nang gi zhi ba ston to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i nang gi zhi ba ston to //
translated: the inner peace of the formless realm is taught here.

original: rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin sgom bdag gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir rnam par thar ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin sgom bdag gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir rnam par thar ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase sign of liberation refers to the formless concentrations of peace, because the practitioner who cultivates concentration attains liberation and nirvana.

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This is the second emptiness, the emptiness that is the antidote.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /üîΩ'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las / 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúThe emptiness of the conditioned is as follows:

original: khams gsum pa stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the emptiness of the three realms.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary to the noble Perfection of Wisdom,

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe emptiness of the conditioned is as follows:

analyzed: rgya dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las skyes pa'i phung po dang / khams la sogs pa don rnam par gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and so on, which arise from the collection of causes and conditions, are said to be empty because they have two kinds of meaning.

original: dang po ni bdag dang bdag gi ba med pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po ni bdag dang bdag gi ba med pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: First, they are empty because the self and that which belongs to the self are not observed.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rnams stong zhing skye ba dang 'gags pa med pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid so zhes bshad de rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //

translated: The second is explained as emptiness because the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are empty and are not observed because they are unborn and unceasing, as is taught extensively in the same text.

original: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par bstan to / // / bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
translated: Here, this sutra also teaches in accordance with what is said in the Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma brgyad pa @189a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma brgyad pa @189a * //
translated: The meaning of the suchness of characteristics is the correct understanding of the eight signs, such as the sign of the selflessness of persons, the sign of the selflessness of phenomena, the sign of mere representation, the sign of the ultimate, and so on.

original: ston te / 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
analyzed: ston te / 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the teaching on the signs and the teaching on emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the signs.

original: 'di ltar gong du mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gsungs pa'i phyir /

original: des mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi yod par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: des mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi yod par gyur pa yin te /
translated: there are four kinds of signs.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma'i phyir ro //
translated: the sign of the selflessness of persons, the sign of the selflessness of things, the sign of mere representation, and the sign of the ultimate.üîΩThey are eliminated by the emptiness of what transcends limits, the emptiness of non-existent things, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existent things, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second teaching of the emptiness that is the antidote.üîΩIn the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: it says:

original: mtha' las 'das la stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das la stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /

original: chos rnams mthar mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams mthar mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of any dharma in the end.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of non-existence is this:

original: dngos po cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po cung zad tsam yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: there is not even the slightest existent that can be apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of the own-being of non-existence is this:

original: chos rnams la tshogs par byed ba'i dngos po dang / tshogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la tshogs par byed ba'i dngos po dang / tshogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the collection of dharmas and the own-being of the collected.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is this:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is nirvana.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las mtha' las 'das pa stong ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las mtha' las 'das pa stong ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes is explained as follows:

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams bshig nas yongs su btsal du med pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams bshig nas yongs su btsal du med pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned and the emptiness of the unconditioned are the dharmas that are destroyed and sought after. The non-existence of that is called the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos gang yang 'gag par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos gang yang 'gag par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is the non-apprehension of any dharma whatsoever.

original: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of any dharma whatsoever, it is said to be the emptiness of non-apprehension.
